name: SequenceMiner
paper: Anomaly detection and diagnosis algorithms for discrete symbol sequences with applications to airline safety
description: SequenceMiner is an unsupervised, scalable method for detecting and explaining anomalies in large collections of discrete symbol sequences (e.g., cockpit switch activations during aircraft landings). It clusters sequences using a similarity based on the normalized longest common subsequence (nLCS), then identifies anomalies as those sequences with low similarity to their clusterâ€™s medoid.
